ComicInfo.Notes: Tagged with comicbox 1.1.1 on 2024-03-14T01:08:50 [Issue ID 4000-227302] urn:comicvine:4000-227302 Tagged with ComicTagger 1.6.0a13.dev122 using info from Grand Comics Database on 2024-06-12 21:37:11. [Issue ID 241844]
ComicInfo.Penciller: Art Bartsch,Jim Tyer,Jim Tyer,Connie Rasinski,Art Bartsch
ComicInfo.Summary:
Dart Men of the Moon: A space force of mouse astronauts, headed by Professor Edam and Mighty Mouse, is bound for the (then) planet Pluto. The Claw’s agents, including a traitorous mouse posing as Professor Edam, sabotage the rocket fleet so that it will barely reach the moon before running out of power. Waiting for them on the moon is villainous Professor Ohm, who has formed a secret alliance with a tribe of “dart men” to attack and overcome the mice upon landing.
Denizens of the Deep: A boxing promotion stunt orchestrated by The Claw and Professor Ohm temporarily sidelines Mighty Mouse, giving the evil cats the opportunity to steal a map from Professor Edam showing the location of vast underwater deposits of uranium. Mighty Mouse takes off after The Claw's gunboat, but the cats have a few surprises in store for our hero.
Jungle Terror: Mighty Mouse protects the smaller creatures of the jungle from larger predators and thwarts the aggressive alliance of hostile pigmies and the Desert Gang, an invading army of large talking gorillas.
Tricky Business: Gandy runs an errand for a magic shop, and asks Sourpuss to mind the shop while he’s gone. Gandy requests that his pal not touch anything until he gets back. Sourpuss, alas, cannot resist temptation.
Hectic Honeymoon: Newlyweds Mr. and Mrs. Mouse unknowingly choose the elephant house at the zoo as their honeymoon home. The expected scared elephants set into motion a delightfully insane chain of events that can only be righted by Mighty Mouse.
Cat Disposal: Mitzi doesn’t need Mighty Mouse to save the day, thanks to a book he sent her.
The Reckless Rabbit: Headstrong young rabbit Rollo eschews baseball with friends in favor of building his own plane and “flying to the moon”. He also doesn’t believe in Mighty Mouse, until danger fills the skies in the form of a fierce windstorm and a flock of hungry eagles. His belief system changes rapidly.
All Washed Up: Gandy ineptly washes a circus elephant, getting himself and Sourpuss fired.
Episode 2643 ½ Terror on the Tracks: Oil Can Harry lets loose a mad bull, and releases a roundhouse-full of roaring locomotives, to imperil Pearl Pureheart and Mighty Mouse.
All Aboard: Dinky builds a train out of two old apple boxes and some wheels. Not to be outdone, Rudy builds a monorail train out of his old bicycle, two wooden barrels, and other odds-and-ends. Before Rudy's two chicks can take a ride, Willie the Weasel takes over the monorail - and is sorry he did.
By Gum: Percy Puss stops up Little Roquefort's pea shooter with a wad of gum.
Suit Looted: Mighty Mouse's suit is stolen by a cat who thinks it's the source of his powers. Silly cat.
Undesirable Character: Percy is ejected from the house by his own giant slingshot.
The Trap: Rudy's flimsy trap for a corn thief, catches the thief... Rudy, himself!
Rooster Stopper: Dinky's new type of cowboy hat foils Rudy's prank on him.
ComicInfo.Tags: Gandy Goose,Oil Can Harry,Dinky Duck,Mighty Mouse,Mitzi Mouse,Pearl Pureheart,Sourpuss,Rudy the Rooster,Little Roquefort,Professor Ohm,Percy Puss,Farmer Al Falfa
